boardgame.name: Zazz
boardgame.description:
One of the first games to use a set of different polyhedral dice.

This is a decision-less game where players take turns rolling dice, and tallying their score. The first player past a point threshold wins.

The rules as published:

The Game is called ZAZZ and it is played with the 5 Natural Solids (Polyspheres).

TETRAHEDRON - has 4 Triangular Faces
CUBE - has 6 Square Faces
OCTAHEDRON - has 8 Triangular Faces
DODECAHEDRON - has 12 Pentagonal Faces
ICOSAHEDRON - has 20 Triangular Faces

Instructions: Each player throws all 5 solids at once as he takes his turn. Player inspects top faces, particularly all 3 showing faces of the TETRAHEDRON. He then adds all pairs or matching numbers plus any number over 12 that appears on the ICOSAHEDRON.

Example: Throw shows TETRAHEDRON 1, 3, 4; CUBE 6; OCTAHEDRON 3; DODECAHEDRON 8; ICOSAHEDRON 14

Add 3 on the TETRAHEDRON to matching 3 on OCTAHEDRON to 14 on ICOSAHEDRON. Score is 20 points.

Bonus of 20 Points for a 3-of-a-kind
Bonus of 50 Points for a 4-of-a-kind
Bonus of 100 Points for BLAST OFF

BLAST OFF occurs when the same throw shows no pairs, 3's, or 4's-of-a-kind and the number appearing on the ICOSAHEDRON is under 12.

A cumulative score of 100 points or a BLAST OFF wins the game.

boardgame.name: Virsch The End -ErroR: Salvation-
終遠のヴィルシュ -ErroR:salvation-
boardgame.description: Visual Novel

boardgame.name: Quiz Master: Terrific Totally Trivia
boardgame.description:
Totally Terrific Trivia is a family trivia game consisting of 900 questions spanning six categories and one six-sided die.

The game can be played with by individuals or teams. The die is used to determine starting player, and afterwards the corresponding question on the trivia card for the category the player or team chooses. The player or team on the left reads out the question. If the player/team gives the correct answer, they keep the card; if not, it is returned to the box and play passes to the left.

The goal of the game is for each team or player to obtain one card from each category. When this happens, the succeeding team or player wins.

Includes: 900 Questions, 1 die, and rules

boardgame.name: Cartoni Morti De Card Gheim
boardgame.description:
Players have to make a story by playing characters one next to the other.

Every characters says something different and the combination can make odd and NSFW stories.

When seven character cards are played on a raw the story is completed and the player that achieved his hidden goal is the Winner!

What about the others?

Well...Losers have to make amends.... with repentance cards!!!

Who are the characters?

Stegosandro, the Mayor of Lignano and other great characters made by the Famuos Youtuber and Artist Andrea Lorenzon. also known as "Cartoni Morti".

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fitness Boxing 2: Rhythm & Exercise
Fitness Boxing 2: Rhythm and Exercise
boardgame.description:
Box to the rhythm of pop hits from home!
Grab your Joy-Con controllers and bob, weave and jab to the rhythm in Fitness Boxing 2: Rhythm & Exercise, featuring a flurry of songs, workouts and modes to enjoy solo or with a training partner!

Played the original? Continue with your fitness goals in Fitness Boxing 2: Rhythm & Exercise by importing your stats from Fitness Boxing!

Move to the music
Crank up the volume and work up a sweat as you box to the beat of 23 punchy tracks, including instrumental versions of hit songs.

One! Two!
Exercising is as easy as one-two! Build your way up to full combos by mirroring your instructor’s movements and following the on-screen icons.

In the zone
Time your punches perfectly to get into the Zone State, bringing the stage to life and letting you rack up extra points! Finish with a high score to unlock new accessories for your instructor.

Fighting fit
In Daily Workout, exercises are tailored to your personal fitness goals, whether that’s targeting a specific area of the body or simply getting in shape.

Set an alarm so you never miss a session (your console will notify you even when it’s in Sleep Mode!) and reap the rewards of daily exercise as you fill your calendar with stamps.

Prefer to keep things spontaneous? Head to Free Training, where you have full control over the intensity of your workout, the stage, the music and the moves you work on.

Training partner
Daily Workout and Free Training can also be enjoyed in two-player co-op. Pass one or two Joy-Con controllers to a friend and work out side by side. Compare stats to keep each other motivated!

Stay on track
Monitor your progress with graphs tracking stats such as your BMI, estimated calorie burn and the number of punches you’ve thrown.

Personal trainer
Choose one of nine instructors – including three new faces, Hiro, Janice and Karen – who are there to provide guidance and encouragement as you work out together.

Customise your instructor’s appearance to suit your style and complete achievements to unlock new clothes, glasses and gloves for them to wear.

Back to basics
Don’t know your hook from your uppercut? No problem! Basic Training gives you the chance to practise the various boxing techniques at your leisure while your instructor demonstrates the proper form.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: 5e NPCs: Woodfolk & Wanderers
Woodfolk and Wanderers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5e NPCs: Woodfolk & Wanderers brings you 10 new NPCs each with their own backstory, stat block and colour art. Custom abilities and unique histories make this a colourful collection of NPCs for your party to encounter.

There are over 20 pages of NPC content with challenges range from 1/8 to 13.

This product includes the following NPCs:

Keelin Canderwall - Clueless Cook
Locklan Greer - Paranoid Pauper
Lyron - Meandering Minstrel
Urrok Waterfell - Distrusting Half-Orc
Annalise Pyre - Fearsome Finder
Madeline Coin - Steadfast Savoir
Cort Weaving - The Weaver of Songs and Stories
Desdemona Inglemere - Undead Convert
Nel - Temptress of the Tarn
Glaistig - The Lady in Green


In addition, there are five new creatures to serve as animal companions and assistants to the NPCs listed above. 5e NPCs: Woodfolk & Wanderers also includes details for three magical instruments.

boardgame.name: Five Dates
boardgame.description:
Five Dates is an exploration of the unpredictable modern dating experience, which follows an average single man as he navigates the world of digital dating.
ABOUT THIS GAME

Five Dates is an interactive rom-com about the unpredictable world of digital dating. With five potential female matches, Vinny explores whether compatibility, chemistry and connection is still possible in a world where physical touch is no longer an option.

Vinny, a millennial from London, joins a dating app for the first time while living in lockdown during the coronavirus pandemic. With five potential female matches, Vinny must pluck up courage to video date with wildly different personalities, starring Mandip Gill (Doctor Who) and Georgia Hirst (Vikings).

The viewer’s choices will define Vinny’s interactions with each date and their interest in seeing him again. Amidst a branching, multi-directional chain of conversation topics and deep-dive questions, Vinny is faced with digital game dates, awkward scenarios and unexpected truths.

Five Dates is an exploration of the unpredictable modern dating experience, which follows an average single man as he navigates the world of digital dating. Through his journey, the decisions the viewer makes for him will challenge their own conceptions of attraction and compatibility.

Relationship Tracking
Throughout the game, your choices and your interactions will either strengthen or weaken your relationship with your date. The relationship scores are calculated from the start right through to the very end and will affect certain scenarios as well as having consequences in the concluding scenes.

Features:
A completely live-action romantic comedy, directed by Paul Rachid (The Complex)​​

Entirely conceptualized, filmed and developed during lockdown​​

Over 7 hours of filmed footage

Real-time Relationship Status Tracking that influences the story as you play

Multi-optional storytelling with 10 different outcomes

Featuring a Pause Choices option for improved audience participation during live streams.

​
Starring Mandip Gill (Doctor Who), Georgia Hirst (Vikings), Sinead Harnett (singer) and Taheen Modak (Two Weeks To Live)

boardgame.name: The Complex
boardgame.description:
The Complex is an interactive sci-fi thriller movie for PC, Mac, PS4, Xbox One and Nintendo Switch.

After a major bio-weapon attack on London, two scientists find themselves in a locked-down laboratory with time, and air, running out. With choose-your-own-path gameplay, your actions and your relationship with other characters will lead you to one of eight suspenseful endings.

Having treated the victims of a chemical attack in the totalitarian state of Kindar, Dr Amy Tenant is a leader in the advancement of Nanocell Technology. Now, in London, news breaks of a blood-vomiting civilian whose identity is far from coincidental. Reunited with an old friend, Amy is trapped in an impenetrable HQ of laboratories—a womb of scientific advancement with a perilous secret.

The Complex is written by Lynn Renee Maxcy, part of the Emmy award-winning writing team from The Handmaid’s Tale. The interactive movie stars Michelle Mylett (Letterkenny, Bad Blood), Kate Dickie (Game of Thrones, The Witch) and Al Weaver (Grantchester). Actors also include Twitch streamer and former Xbox UK presenter, Leah Viathan.

Relationship Tracking
Throughout the game you will interact with characters and — depending on your choices — will either strengthen or weaken your relationship. The relationship scores are calculated from the start right through to the very end and will affect certain scenarios as well as having major consequences in the concluding scenes.

Personality Tracking
For every decision you make, every interaction, your character’s personality is being tracked. At the end of each playthrough, you are rewarded with a Personality Score and a breakdown to see how you played the game. Discover the five basic dimensions of a personality; openness, conscientiousness, extraversion, agreeableness and neuroticism. Which of those will your character play?

Features

A completely live action, cinematic interactive movie sci-fi thriller, filmed in the UK.

​​

Multi directional story with 8 different endings.​​​​

​​

Real-time Relationship Status Tracking that influences the story as you play.

​

Real-time Personality Trait Tracking that evolves based on your choices.

​

Unlockable features include Skip Scene, Personality Assessment and a Hidden Event.

Featuring a Pause Choices option for improved audience participation during live streams.

​

Directed by Paul Raschid, and written by Lynn Renee Maxcy (The Handmaid's Tale - TV Series).


Acting performances by Michelle Mylett (Letterkenny, Bad Blood), Kate Dickie (Game of Thrones, The Witch) and Al Weaver (Grantchester).


Guest starring Twitch streamer and Xbox UK presenter Leah Viathan.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: GVE
boardgame.description:
Themed based on Gods, Immortals and Celestials battling one another until the strongest remains.

Game can be played up from 2 to 4 players with the goal of eliminating your opponent's active warriors to seize victory. The game mainly revolves around rolling the dice in order to decide your move and your cards to decide your strength or weakness.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Citytrip Bruges
Citytrip Brügge
Citytrip Brugge
boardgame.description:
As a tour guide in Citytrip Brugge you want to create the most memorable trip by visiting famous buildings and musea, events, restaurants and more.

Citytrip Brugge is a flip & write game that is quick to setup and easy to play. With a basic and advanced scoresheet, 23 starting points and 44 different missions, no 2 games will feel the same!

One player flips the upper card of the action stack. Simultaneously everybody chooses 2 actions that are horizontally or vertically adjacent (=7 possible combinations). Each player creates a road and circles achieved goals which give points on the scoresheet. The game ends after 15 turns. The player with the highest satisfaction score wins Citytrip Brugge.

— description from the designer —

boardgame.name: Dice: Rendezvous with Randomness
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Whether God plays dice is up to theologians and metaphysicians to decide. What's more certain, however, is that many tabletop and role playing gamers do, and they love it. If you have any animosity toward geekiness, there is no need to read on, because this book is a veritable cornucopia for dice geekery.

Publisher's blurb:

See dice in a way you`ve never seen them before in Dice - Rendezvous with Randomness! Måns Danneman has curated a fine selection of images in this rich catalogue of unusual dice photographed with spectacular effects.

boardgame.name: ナワバリ (Nawabari)
boardgame.description:
In ナワバリ (Nawabari), the players compete over a series of rounds to score the most points.

Each round is composed of 3 or 4 turns, in which players will draft a card from a row. At the start of each turn, some cards are turned face up and ordered by number. The players each draft a card in the order of their tokens, from left to right, and the placement of these tokens on the cards from this turn will determine the turn order for the next round.

Once selected, a player takes the chosen card and places it in front of themselves. The cards have a number of attributes, such as odd/even number; terrain type; and card effect. Some cards provide an immediate benefit; others allow conversions; and some are conditional effects.

At the end of each round, players will score for the current round's scoring card, and other scoring types. Afterwards, the players simultaneously choose one card from their tableau to keep, which also determines turn order for the next round.

boardgame.name: Lingering Injury System
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Does it sometimes feel unsatisfying that a fifth-edition character can drop to zero hit points (essentially be on death's door), receive healing, then be back to full fighting strength with absolutely zero repercussions? If so, this lingering injury system might help.

Basically, it presents a very simple set of rules whereby there are mechanical consequences--lingering injuries--when a character drops to zero hit points. These lingering injuries are designed to introduce consequences to the game, but NOT heavy-handed ones.

boardgame.name: Count Up
boardgame.description:
Count Up is a card game from Japan. Players draw from a deck and play cards from their hand face-up to a central stack, accumulating the total as they go. If a player can exactly hit a target, 11, 22, 33 and so on, the other players take penalty chips.

Instead of a number card, a player can place an action card, which trigger simple effects. Players fight a duel with hand cards, exchange cards, change direction, play two cards, play a wild card 1-3 and so on.

The game ends when a player takes the total over 100, and hand cards force more penalties. The player with the fewest penalty chips at the end is the winner.

The action cards have a simple English keyword and graphics, so the game is playable by anyone who can count.
user summary

boardgame.name: Where's Wally? Find it Fast! Game
boardgame.description:
The Where’s Wally Find It Fast game is a brilliant, fun, quick paced matching game! Pick a card that contains a multiple images of Where’s Wally and other general objects then roll the picture dice – find an image on the dice that matches one on the card to win the round. The player who finds the most matches wins.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Alias: Ensimmäinen Muumi
boardgame.description: A word explanation game in Finnish starting from ages 3 and up. The game has cards with pictures and the words are written both in Finnish and in Swedish. The game itself is set in Moominvalley and many characters are presented in playing cards.

boardgame.name: どくたーのぐっち (Dokuta no Guchi)
Ｄｒ．野口っち (Dr. Nogucchi)
boardgame.description:
Ｄｒ．野口っち (Dr. Nogucchi) どくたーのぐっち (Dokuta no Guchi) is a game from Japan which includes a model microscope. Players use the fake microscope to study specimens, looking for the cure, the silver bullet to cure a terrible disease (the game was first published in 2017!).

Players look through the microscope to identify different viruses. If a player is confident that they have the cure, they declare and gain 2 points if correct, or lose 1 pt if wrong. Other players can still find the cure and gain a point. The first to get to 5 points is the winner.

The specimens are card hexes with different combinations of microbes showing in each part. When a player peeks into the microscope, the card is rotated, so they only see a section at a time. Remember what you have seen in the scope is important to the game.

There are tokens for the microbes and for coloured test tubes of drugs. Players build up a collection of drugs and bugs behind their laboratory screen. When a player is confident they have the right combo to complete the cure, they can declare.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

boardgame.name: Wolfpack: The North Atlantic Convoy Struggles October 1941 - March 1943
boardgame.description:
Wolfpack is a tactical, historical game depicting the struggles between the German submarine Wolfpacks and the allied merchant convoys of WWII. Wolfpack is set in the vast North Atlantic from late 1941 to early 1943.

Wolfpack is a 1-4 player solitaire/team game. When playing solo, the player will command 2 - 4 submarines. In a team game, players will command 1 - 2 submarines depending on the number of players. The convoy merchant ships and escorts will be controlled by an AI system. In Wolfpack, players will assume the role of a German WWII submarine commander. Players will need to work together to achieve victory.

In a game of Wolfpack, players will start by approaching the Allied merchant ship convoy while trying to make it through the escort's screen undetected. If successful, your submarine will make an attack run on the convoy. As the commander, you will make many decisions like maneuvering your submarine to the best firing angle while making TDC (torpedo data computer) calculations for each of your torpedos, trying to achieve your best shot. You will issue orders to your crew to deal with any damage that your submarine may have sustained. Should we run silent? Do we press the attack? The decisions are up to you. Do all of this while trying to sink as much allied merchant ship tonnage as possible and avoid being detected and sent to the bottom by the allied escort ships.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Clash of Deck N°5
boardgame.description:
Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the fifth expansion of the game. Each month, a new expansion is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. A new game mechanic makes its appearance: the cards which rotate on themselves. You will also be able to discover two new special abilities that will add even more combos and depth to your games: Aquatic and Hidden!

boardgame.name: Coffee Traders
커피 트레이더스
boardgame.description:
Thousands of coffee farmers all over the world support their families by using small stretches of hillside land for their coffee plantations. Farmers work day in and day out for very little, but the future of coffee farming is bright. Fair Trade organizations strive to improve living conditions for these farmers by helping them set up cooperatives. This enables them to establish better pricing agreements and take out loans for new plantations, all to help provide education and improve the quality of their lives, families, societies, and environment.

In Coffee Traders, set in 1970s Central and South America, Africa, and Asia, the delicious Arabica coffee beans farmers harvest are sold in Antwerp — and all over the world — to coffee roasters large and small. Work with your competitors to develop the regions you see fit for the best coffee beans while keeping a watchful eye on the market. Construct buildings to help your Fair Trade coffee plantations thrive while enhancing your network for trading coffee. Will your plantations fall to ruin, or will you rise to the top and become the world's greatest coffee trader?

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 Golden Geek Heavy Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Bakedora ~ Bakemonotaibakemono Dorahutogemu ~
化けドラ～化け物對化け物ドラフトゲーム～ (BAKEDORA- The Monster War Draft Game)
boardgame.description:
化けドラ～化け物對化け物ドラフトゲーム～ (Bakedora ~ Bakemonotaibakemono Dorahutogemu) (BAKEDORA- The Monster War Draft Game) is a 2 player card-drafting, deck-building game from Japan, themed on the battle between monsters.

Effectively play the cards with odd effects, such as a card that you make you lose if you play it, and a card that provides you 1000 additional turns! Try to find the best combinations!

魑魅魍魎をドラフト＆デッキ構築！
奇妙な効果を巧みに使いこなそう！
最高の組み合わせを見つけ出せ！
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Augmented Reality PLUS
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Augmented Reality PLUS contains the Drop Down Grids from the original document, for easy printing, PLUS the 2D10 variant grids (rather than drop dice on the grid, which you can still do, you can roll 2D10 instead - one you read down, the other across).

Also includes bonus material from the blog; expanded descriptions and roles for the Gig Economy table found in Augmented Reality, as well as 50 cloak and dagger ways for those mysterious coprorate clients to make first contact.

boardgame.name: Bayt al Azif (Issue 03)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The magazine dedicated to adventuring against the Cthulhu Mythos continues!

Issue #3 includes:

3 adventures dual-statted for Call of Cthulhu 7th edition and GUMSHOE (Trail of Cthulhu/The Fall of DELTA GREEN)
A mysterious murderer stalks the industrial workers of Berlin (Classic Era 1920s, 19 pages)
A military team is sent to investigate a radio signal in the arctic (Cold War, 15 pages)
A group attends an early opening of an exhibit by a famed blown glass artist (Modern, 19 pages)

An overview of every Cthulhu Mythos RPG release of 2019
An interview with Sandy Petersen, the creator of Call of Cthulhu
Advice, history, comics, and more!

boardgame.name: Middenheim: City of the White Wolf
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Famed for its impregnability, set atop the mighty Fauschlag, struck flat by Ulric’s fist, Middenheim commands authority over all who stand beneath its towering presence. Hewn from living rock by peerless Dwarf skill, it is a striking fortress city where Ulric, the God of War, Winter and Wolves, reigns supreme. The sacred Eternal Flame burns pure and bright, in the heart of a city famed throughout the Old World, riven by dark cults, clambering merchants, and seditious schemers. Middenheim has little room for heroes, and less time for wasters, but for canny opportunists with the will and grit to carve a small piece of something better? Well, they might stand a chance.

Middenheim: City of the White Wolf takes players out of the familiar Grand Province of the Reikland, and drops them in the centre of Ulrican influence and power in the Old World. Middenheim sits at the heart of the Empire’s Northern expanse, and is the perfect setting for endless grim and perilous adventure! Each district of the expansive city is carefully detailed, with locations, plot hooks and NPCs too numerous to list. A beautifully illustrated map, provided with both GM and Player versions, shows off the city in exquisite detail. Need an Inn in the Altmarket? A Pawnbroker in The Kleinmoot? Details on the Kisvilite Embassy? Middenheim has everything you require.

Middenheim: City of the White Wolf distils the best of previous writing on the chosen city of Ulric, and combines it with new creatures, new NPCs, new locations, and rules to create the ultimate sourcebook for groups wishing to adventure in Middenheim and its surrounds. Full rules for creating Middenheimer, Middenlander and Nordlander Characters are included, along with a new career for true devotees of Ulric.

A stand-alone book, Middenheim: City of the White Wolf also makes an excellent supplement for those intending to run Power Behind the Throne, part three of The Enemy Within campaign. While the companion content is very focused on the events of Power Behind the Throne, this book provides more details on the city for GMs who are happy to let their groups explore more widely. It details Middenheim around 2512 IC, prior to the events of The Enemy Within, but includes an appendix with updates on how future events are set to alter the city.

Middenheim: City of the White Wolf includes:


A History of Middenheim: A timeline of events leading up to the present day, detailing the cities past as a stronghold of the Ulrican faith and one time home to the usurper Wolf Emperors
A Visitors [sic]Guide: Eighty pages of detailed locations, NPCs and plot hooks set throughout the city’s many districts
Dark Cults of Middenheim: A run down on the cults and conspiracies that make Middenheim their home, any one of which could threaten the very fabric of political, cultural, or religious life in the city
The Duchy of Middenheim: Middenheim is more than just a city — it also commands the territories that surround it, as far away as coastal Nordland. The Duchy of Middenheim provides details on regions directly within ambit of the city, as well as the often fractious nobility that control them
Bestiary, Characters and more: Additional beasts, new Character options for creating local adventurers, and the Wolf Kin career for those willing to embody the spirit of Ulric in all things.


Middenheim: City of the White Wolf is an excellent and entertaining addition to any gaming table. Packed with lore, NPCs, and exciting adventure hooks, it will kickstart your next adventure in Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay!

boardgame.name: Chat pardeurs
boardgame.description:
Chat pardeur is a tactical and lucky microgame for 2 players facing each other during 5-minute games and can be played from 5 years old.

Fear has seized San Franciscat. Food factories are the target of recurrent robberies. But have no fear, Supercat is determined to bring the thieves to justice.
If you are the Kitthief, you have to steal 5 foods of the same type to win. If you are supercat, you must stop the Kitthief by knocking him out.

The kitthief secretly chooses a food on the food card by placing his token on it. Supercat has to guess which food is selected.
If supercat has made a mistake, the kitthief raises the token corresponding to the food on the card.
If supercat has found it, he rolls the dice and try to hit the kitthief.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Tierra Feudal
boardgame.description:
Tierra Feudal (Feudal Land) is a card game where we represent the leader of a noble house from medieval Europe. We are on a mission to develop our fiefdom better than anyone else through the recruitment of new vassals, the construction of buildings, the establishment of production improvements and, of course, the growth of our military defenses.

Starting from a few cards, we will have to manage the production of resources to be able to get better characters, buildings and nobles from the market that allow us to make more efficient and productive combinations of cards. We will have to carefully plan our acquisitions since the lack of chance in the game will place almost all the responsibility of defeat or victory on our decisions.

After the construction of a certain amount of buildings the game will end. The military and economic power, the productive capacities, the power of the church and the nobles under our vassalage will determine the victory points that we get and the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Injustice Season Pass
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Downloadable Pack that includes the following:

4 new fighters, Lobo, Batgirl, Scorpion, Zod
Flashpoint Skins for Wonder Woman, Aquaman, and Deathstroke
S.T.A.R. Lab Missions for Lobo, Batgirl, Scorpion and Zod

boardgame.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Resin Veteran Preacher
boardgame.description: Miniature to be used as an alternative to the miniature for the Preacher class included with Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death. This miniature was part of the goody box offered online by Flying Frog to coincide with their virtual version of DiceFest 2020, Flying Frog Productions' annual convention.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death

boardgame.name: Mortal Kombat X - Kombat Pack
boardgame.description:
Adds 4 new fighters to the base game: Jason Voorhees, Predator, Tanya and Tremor.

Also includes the Samurai Skin Pack

Kombat Pack grants early access to 4 upcoming playable characters and skin packs. Slash your opponents as Horror Icon Jason Voorhees, or play as Predator, the Ultimate Hunter. Klassic characters Tanya and Tremor complete the offer. Each fighter comes with a themed skin pack including three new skins for select characters. Also includes The Samurai Pack available April 14.

boardgame.name: Hollerith^5
Hollerith⁵
boardgame.description:
Hollerith⁵ consists of a 6x6 game board with a hole in each space large enough to hold a marble, as well as marbles in two colors and five perforated plates; each plate covers a 3x3 area, which means that four of the plates together cover the entire game board. Each perforated plate has nine holes so that you can see whether a hole in the game board is filled with a marble, but only one or two holes per plate are large enough for a marble to pass through. (These holes are marked as such on the plates.)

On a turn, you push the fifth plate onto the game board, displacing one of the plates already there, then you insert one of your marbles into an unoccupied hollow of the game board. Players alternate turns until one of them forms a row of four marbles and wins. Note that if you cannot insert a marble into an empty space on the game board, you lose instantly.

boardgame.name: Futatsu no Tsumi to San'nin no Shisha
二つの罪と三人の死者 ～二人用脱出ミステリー～ (Two Sins and Three Dead: A Two-Person Escape Mystery)
boardgame.description:
二つの罪と三人の死者 ～二人用脱出ミステリー～ (Futatsu no Tsumi to San'nin no Shisha) (Two Sins and Three Dead: A Two-Person Escape Mystery) is a game from Japan.

This is a mystery game to move the story forward through conversation. At a friend's house at night, there is a suspicious person under the bed... What are the consequences for A and B, who both have their secrets?

会話で物語を進めるミステリー
友人宅の夜、ベッドの下に不審者が……
それぞれの秘密を抱えるAとBが迎える結末とは？
publisher's summary

In this 2 player game, the player's adopt the roles of persons 'A' and 'B'. B is visiting A and stays in A's university room. But at night, they realise there is a suspicious figure under A's bed. B is alarmed, even more so by A's calm response.

During the game, the players converse, trying to get information to undercover the truth. The game has three main endings that can be reached, but the players each have secrets (hidden through QR codes), so the players cannot be sure how the game will end. This gives the game much replay ability, even if they do reach an ending.

Players get information from cards in the game, dependent on where they are in the room, or from keywords appearing in the talking. The players are allowed to reveal information, or hide, or even lie if they wish. The game may unfold as the players wish, or they be disturbed by the secrets revealed (the game is aimed at older players). Playing out the roles in different ways may make the endings change too.

Players will need access to some digital device to examine the QR codes in the game.
user summary

boardgame.name: DM Options: Monster Talents II
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

DM Options: Monster Talents II is the follow up to the PLATINUM best selling Monster Talents.

It contains over 200 pages of monstrous 'talents,' or features you can add to a creature's existing repertoire with the intent of making it a unique or a more challenging encounter. This time the book covers the official follow-up bestiaries Volo's Guide to Monsters and Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes and features over a dozen exclusive artwork. There should be enough here to keep your players on their toes.

Chapter 1. Talents for the creatures from Volo's Guide to Monsters.

Chapter 2. Talents for the creatures from Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes

Chapter 3. Bonus Sampler Statblocks. 50 statblocks of creatures from VGtM and MToF enhanced by talents and adjusted CR.

boardgame.name: Russian Railroads: Manufactory Train
boardgame.description:
A mini-extension available as a free "Print & Play" version. Just print it and cut it out.

Setup:
• Place the manufactory train next to the game board, clearly visible for all players.
• Shuffle all 11 manufactory tiles, face-down, draw 2 of them at random and place them on the 2 right spaces on the manufactory train, faceup. The first space remains empty for now.
• Draw 3 more tiles and place them next to the manufactory train-board, on the left, faceup.• Put the stack of 6 remaining manu-factory tiles above the train-board.

Gameplay:
The manufactory train works like any other action space in RRR.
• If you place a worker or coin on the train, you have to pick one of the 3 faceup manufactory tiles and place it onto the first (empty) space on the train – the space right behind the engine.
• Next you have to perform all three actions, shown on the manufactory tiles, in their entirety. If that is not possible, you cannot use the manufactory train action space. The order, however, is up to you.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: The Brambles: A Solo Card Game
boardgame.description:
You are the Teller, a local practitioner of spiritual arts and keeper of “The Collection”, a set of Tarot-like cards compiled from various old sources. For generations, the knowledge of the Collection has been passed down to Tellers to be used to tell fortunes, give blessings, cast spells, and most importantly to fight the dark evils that inhabit the haunted brambles. This morning, two local children have gotten trapped by the dark evils in the brambles. Parishfolk are counting on you as the Teller to use the Collection to fight the dark evils and free the children from the wicked brambles.

The Brambles is a solo card game where your goal is to save the children caught by the dark evils of the haunted brambles. To release the children, you must play different card combinations powerful enough to defeat the 20 Bramble Evils, thereby releasing the children. If you fail to defeat the evils before the Collection runs out, the children are lost to the Brambles forever.

boardgame.name: Roof Rage
boardgame.description:
Roof Rage is a Martial Arts Platform Fighter featuring epic rooftop battles.

Roof Rage is a fast paced, easy to pick, hard to master, platform fighter.

It is both a party game and a competitive game for platform fighter's players.
The scale and speed of Roof Rage allows you to be creative, always producing new combos and pushing the gameplay a little bit further.
With the last 5 characters added since the initial release, the game now has 13 characters, each one offering a unique playstyle.
You can pick and throw roof tiles, catch them, deflect your opponent's projectiles, wave-dash, parry and smash attack for a finishing move.
Pick your stage among 13 iconic, cultural inspired, rooftops.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Puzzle Master
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Greetings traveler, you are invited to the grand opening of Aenigma's premiere puzzle dungeon! Congratulations on receiving this illustrious invitation! You'd best be on your way. Dragons don't like to be kept waiting.

Challenge and delight your players with the premiere issue of Puzzle Master! Inside this supplement, you will find ten puzzles suitable for every level of play, accompanied by beautifully rendered handouts.

Puzzle Master also includes a unique dungeon that utilizes the puzzles to craft an escape room-style experience.

boardgame.name: Really?! Think you know me? Guess again!
boardgame.description:
What new, fun, and unpredictable things will you discover about yourself and about your friends and family while playing the award-winning BEST FAMILY FUN board game - Really?! Think you know me? Guess again! ?
The fun family board game that bridge's the generation gap. Learn more about your loved ones with this hilarious family conversation starter game.

The Q&A cards ask surprising life questions with a list of up to 6 answers for players to guess & choose from. The answers are already included, just mark your chosen answer on your personal Number Dial.

The questions and the answers are thought-provoking, humorous, out-of-the-ordinary, and engage in fun conversation every time you play.

GAME CONTENTS:
Inside the 24oz life-size Really?! Tumbler you will find 70 Surprising Q&A Cards with a twist, 6 Unique Answer Dials for Guessing & Choosing, 60 mesmerizing play ICE Pieces, Short & Clear Instructions, and a handy Wrist Strap for easy travel.

QUICK GAMEPLAY:
1. Read the Q&A Card Out Loud
2. Choose & Guess Your Answer on Your Number Dial
3. Really?! … Reveal Your Answer and Be Amazed!
a. Guess correctly and return ICE Pieces to the Tumbler.
b. If there are no correct guesses, you may have just learned something new!
When all your ICE Pieces are in—YOU WIN!

Connect with your loved ones from a different angle!

THE AWARD-WINNING BEST FAMILY FUN PARTY GAME The hilarious family-friendly fun game that everyone will want to play! Game nights will never be the same! Play in person and/or using online video call platforms with family, friends, at slumber parties, as an office icebreaker & parties of all types.

24oz of FUN & SURPRISE Discover fun and quirky facts about yourself and other players while choosing and guessing answers (already included) to the surprising life question cards containing a variety of engaging topics that will get you talking and laughing!
QUICK & EASY TO PLAY AND REPLAY Simple rules that takes seconds to learn! Play and replay as the answers can change with time and with the players! For ages 8+; 2-6 players (combine Really?! games for more players).

ALL OF A SUDDEN, EVERYONE’S GOT SOMETHING TO SAY! Strike up spontaneous conversation and laughter (for the shy ones as well) while bonding & connecting with your friends & family across all generations! The game that brings you closer together and bridge’s the generation gap!

UNIQUE & MEANINGFUL GIFT IDEA Perfect to give as a birthday present 8+, dinner party gift, holiday gift, for slumber party fun, and as a unique gift that teens will love! It can be played as an office icebreaker and as a team builder game (or simply just because you love to give unique all occasion gifts). Game nights will never be the same! Get Yours Today!

Follow us to be the first to find out about our news games and expansion sets that are being created at this very moment!
Wishing you a REALLY FUN day!

boardgame.name: Old Century Drag Racing
boardgame.description:
Intro:

1934 on the flats of the California desert Drag Racing was born.
1940’s-1950’s grew the popularity of illegal street racing among high-schoolers


Finding a quick thrill and showing off their cars.

Mid 1950’s the first legal ¼ mile drag strip was built and the popularity grew.
Today exists many different classes of professional drag racing from top fuel, funny car, pro-stock, and more…….with large purses to be won.
Old Century Drag Racing captures the excitement in a quick easy head to head competitive match right on your kitchen table.


Gentleman/Ladies – Start Your Engines!

Object of the Game:
Compete in a one-time ¼ mile classic style drag race and be the first to cross the finish line, or a best out of three or five races for a more competitive race. Best out of three or five races is recommended.

boardgame.name: Tangier to Tehran: a Wargamer guide to Middle Eastern Armies of the Napoleonic & Pre-colonial era c1780-1830
boardgame.description:
Tangier to Tehran
Basic set of wargaming rules for 6mm and a guide about the armies of the middle east during the 1780-1830 period.

It cover the armies, navies and potted history of the Arab states of the period (Morocco, Algeria, Tunis, Tripoli, Egypt, Syria, Palestine, Lebanon, Persia, Hejaz, Iraq, Wahhabis of the Nejd, Yemen, Oman), as well as foreign interventionists (Turkey, Great Britain, France, Russia, USA, Sweden).
It includes drawings of uniforms, maps and flags

Published in 1994, updated in 2012.

boardgame.name: Small Ball
boardgame.description:
Small Ball is a two-player, push-your-luck dice game that celebrates the highly strategic style of baseball known as "small ball", which places an emphasis on manufacturing runs by way of single-base advancements and aggressive base running.

Teams are made up of nine unique dice that each reflect the typical characteristics of batters in a lineup, including the lead-off hitter who gets on base, the clean-up hitter who is capable of powerful extra-base hits, and the pitcher who can sacrifice a runner over.

​Small Ball challenges teams to score runs by making tough, strategic decisions - when to steal a base, when to lay down a sacrifice, when to call the hit-and-run, and when to go to the bench for a pinch hitter - and implements a major rule change that makes decisions even more grueling.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: トレンド・ザ・ブランチ (Trend: The Branch)
时装街
boardgame.description:
トレンド・ザ・ブランチ (Trend: The Branch) is a stand-alone card game from Japan with a theme of the apparel business that re-implements the 2018 release トレンド (TREND). In this edition, players are still staff of an apparel shop. There is an additional branch system that uses multiple shop cards with special effects and combines these effects.

While the rules are similar to the original game, differences in this edition are:
1. Introduction of a new rule to add a branch - This allows the effects and abilities of shop cards to be used in combination.
2. Adding of four seasons to the character card - With the addition of the four seasons, you can enjoy the changing trends of the seasons and the changing fashion of the city.
3. Simple changes to the sales and pass rules - The basic rules have been revised to be simpler and easier to play.
4. All 132 cards - The number of cards has increased by 50 from the previous game, making it a more challenging game. Overall, the number of trend elements has increased to 20 and the number of shops to 12.
user summary

boardgame.name: Tendōsetsu (Theory Of The Moving Heavens) (Ptolemaic Theory)
－天動説－ (Geocentric Theory)
boardgame.description:
－天動説－ (Tendōsetsu) (Geocentric Theory) is a game from Japan, with players sailing ships on a Flat Earth. The game title translates more literally as Theory Of The Moving Heavens. Geocentric Theory (often simplified as Ptolemaic Theory) puts the Earth at the centre of the Universe.

The players sail their ships on the oceans, searching for the treasure island of the Pirate King. But if they sail too close to the edge of the world, over they go!

The game includes an Armillary sphere to help the players navigate. There is a day phase and a night phase. During the day, the navigator reads the winds and the waves, and at night, the stars. When an undiscovered island is found, players can search for clues to the location of the gold and silver treasures.

As well as the 20cm tall sphere, the game also has the sea in a box. When it is not their turn, a player moves the box around to bring the sound of the sea alive.
user summary

boardgame.name: Mortal Kombat X - Kombat Pack 2
boardgame.description:
Includes access to Goro, Jason Voorhees, Tanya, the Predator, and Tremor, as well as the opportunity to get these characters a week earlier than those who don't have the Kombat Pack. In addition to this, Kombat Pack owners also have the opportunity to get the included Skin Packs early was well. The skin packs included are the Samurai Pack, the Horror Pack, Klassic Pack 1, the Predator/Prey Pack and Klassic Pack 2.

Kombat Pack 2 grants access to 4 new playable characters, as well as previously released content including Goro, Kold War Skin Pack and 2 Klassic Fatality Packs. New characters include Horror icon Leatherface, and the Xenomorph from Alien . Bo’ Rai Cho and Triborg the Cyber Ninja complete the offer. Also includes the Apocalypse Pack with three new character skins.

boardgame.name: Lobo
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




The game was officially cancelled or abandoned and is no longer in development. An unfinished version(s) of it may or may not have been made available to the public at some point.




Lobo is an unreleased Mega Drive fighting game developed by Ocean of America. It is based off the DC Comics book series of the same name, and was due to be released in the Winter of 1996. A Super Nintendo version was also planned, but both copies were cancelled last minute.

The game uses pre-rendered graphics, similar to Donkey Kong Country or Mortal Kombat, and also makes use of the Mega Drive Six Button Control Pad.

A prototype of the Mega Drive version was released by SEGASaturno.com in September 2009 after generating 390€. It is unknown if any Super NES copies of the game exist. In this prototype there are six playable characters; Lobo, Shaola, Nitro, Dox, Kringle and Loo, each with their own stage. Only Lobo is available during the "Solo" mode.

boardgame.name: Oddia
boardgame.description:
Oddia is a contraction for "Odd and Diagonal." It means that when a player gets an odd number, they should move their token diagonally (except when the token in in a corner square.)

The object of Oddia is to gain the highest points by moving the tokens to reach the Target. Each token reaching the target will get one point.

Game Setup
The game board consists of 36 squares along the sides of the board making up the game zone. The middle part of the board with diagonal lines (squares) only function as a passage and tokens cannot stop on it. Start is on one corner and 19 which is the Target is on the opposite corner.

Players take multiple sets of 10 tokens in their color depending on how many players are playing (2 players = 6 sets, 3 players = 4 sets, 4 players 3 sets.) The tokens are numbered 1-10 in each set.

The game starts with setting up the board for the first 12 turns. Players take turns putting their "1" tokens on start, rolling one die (for the 1st 6 turns, 2 dice after that) and moving forward. Play moves counter-clockwise around the board. When moving diagonal, play moves clockwise.

If they land on another player the player sitting on that square is bumped diagonally across the board. If a player lands on a player in corner square, the player sitting in that corner square is bumped on backward. As more tokens are placed on the board multiple chain-reactions can take place, bumping multiple players to new spaces. After 12 "1" tokens have been played on the board the game is ready to start.

Game Play
During game play only 12 tokens are allowed on the board. Tokens can be replaced with higher numbered tokens.

During game play you choose which one token you wish to move. Once a token reaches the Target (19 space) they replace their token with the next higher number token which gets placed on start and if the dice number is higher than the number needed to reach the Target then the upgraded token moves the additional spaces from the Start space.

The game continues until on person reaches the target with their number 10 token. Their points for that token will be 11. All players then count the number of all their tokens on the board and the player with the highest point total wins.

boardgame.name: BitterSweet
boardgame.description:
You've brought home a delectably devious box of chocolates. Upon opening, you discover a note!

"Thank you for choosing us for your chocolate eating journey! Enjoy our classic dark, milk, and white chocolates along with our new crimson chocolates, made from a mixture of rose petals and cocoa beans. Our chocolate boxes are known for being delectably devious, which is why you’ll find our chocolates individually wrapped and indistinguishable.

We’re positive you’ll want to get your favorites before anyone else does. For those with more adventurous palates, please enjoy the chocolate-covered vegetables also included. "

BitterSweet is a fast, two player game with elements of drafting, push-your-luck, and memory. Players compete to gather their favorites chocolates while avoiding those they might find unappetizing. Each round your preferences change, altering the dynamics of individual cards and what you want most!

—description from the designer

Player and GM versions of nine 100x100 foot geomorph tiles.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing both versions of the player's map.
A short readme PDF.

boardgame.name: Irontooth's Hold
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A boat lies moored at the foot of a large cliff where a small opening can be found with stone stairs carved into it. The winding stairs seem to go on forever but, finally you arrive in the hold.

In the main living area there is a feasting table full of food and a large parchment map of the surrounding kingdoms, at the end of the table also lies an altar with a shield and twin swords upon it. A small set of sleeping quarters is connected to this area, as well as an armory and then the kitchen which looks over the valley below.

Next to the kitchen is a large open cavern and a bridge that leads over to another set of stairs that continues to climb up through the mountain. At the top of the stairs across a natural bridge lies a bastion covered in a large set of ballistas.

boardgame.name: Abandoned Bastion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The path leads through a forest, past a lake and to the foot of a large cliff where a small opening can be found with stone stairs carved into it. The winding stairs seem to go on forever but, finally you arrive in the old abandoned hold.

There are multiple rooms and then two sets of stairs that lead deeper into the compound. The stairs take you to a large open cavern and a bridge that leads over to more stairs that continues to climb up through the mountain. At the top of the stairs across a natural bridge lies the bastion.

boardgame.name: MLB Baseball Trivia Challenge
boardgame.description: If you love Major League Baseball and think you know baseball better than anyone else, here’s your chance to prove it with the new MLB Baseball Trivia Challenge board game. To win, you’ll need more than baseball knowledge and luck on your side because strategy is what separates this unique trivia game from the pack. With 1,000 questions, every baseball player will have to be up to the challenge. For MLB fans who think they've got game, it's time to put on your cap, grab your bat, and knock it out of the park in the new Baseball Trivia Challenge.

boardgame.name: Sophie's Dice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sophie's Dice is a dice roller application that lets you roll many kinds of virtual dice, and make custom dice suited for almost any game.

Features:


Select dice from your collection, or enter dice expressions using standard dice notation
Support for many roll behaviours such as keeping or dropping highest/lowest X dice, explosion, dice pool counting, and more
Save roll expressions you frequently use, to re-roll them easily
Includes dice used for most table-top RPGs*
Easily edit dice to make them your own
Includes many pre-made dice, over 300 rollable dice shapes, and lots of images/sound effects for all kinds of custom dice
Display your own images on dice faces, and your own sound effects for when they come up**
Dice are saved as .xml files you can share with other people who have Sophie's Dice**
Input stats from your character sheet to use in roll expressions

boardgame.name: Mega Mouth
boardgame.description:
Everyone is a lip-reader in this game of massive mouth magnification.

Draw a category card, hold the mega-magnifier up to your mouth, and silently speak to your teammates. Don't say the words out loud! Players are awarded tokens for every answer they guess correctly.

boardgame.name: Injustice 2 - Fighter Pack 1
boardgame.description:
Adds 3 new playable characters: Red Hood, Starfire, and Sub-Zero

Also includes the Gods Shader Pack and the Power Girl Premiere Skin

boardgame.name: Injustice 2 - Fighter Pack 2
boardgame.description:
Adds 3 New Playable Characters: Black Manta, Raiden, and Hellboy

Also includes the Reverse-Flash Premiere Skin

boardgame.name: Magna-Tiles: Treasure Hunt
boardgame.description: Magna-Tiles: Treasure Hunt combines the power of play with hands-on learning and creativity! Collect golden coins in Jungle Treasure, act like a monkey in Island Race, or create their own game by making new rules! Magna-Tiles: Treasure Hunt is a great first game that grows with your child and encourages fine motor skills, imagination, social development, and more!

boardgame.name: Injustice 2 - Fighter Pack 3
boardgame.description:
Adds 3 New Playable Characters: Atom, Enchantress, and TMNT

Also includes a John Stewart Green Lantern Premiere Skin

boardgame.name: Skies Above Britain
boardgame.description:
Skies Above Britain is a solitaire game depicting a Royal Air Force squadron of Hurricanes or Spitfires waging a desperate effort to disrupt and destroy German daylight bombing raids over southeast England in the summer of 1940.

The player's individual aircraft -- each represented by a stickered block -- must locate the incoming raid, intercept it, and evade or defeat swarms of escorting German fighters that usually outnumber you and whose pilots have superior experience and tactics.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Rattlesnake Jake
boardgame.description: Rattlesnake Jake has stolen your gold! Watch out for his rattle, and carefully sneak the gold back. One wrong move… and he strikes! His ominous rattle builds the suspense for the ultimate jump! If Rattlesnake Jake strikes on your turn, you must return half of your nuggets to him. The player with the most gold when the last nugget has been taken wins the game.

boardgame.name: Boerende Barry
Burping Bobby
boardgame.description: Bobby loves stinky food! Feed him, but watch out – you never know when he’s going to BUUUURRRRP! Real lights and steam will burst from his mouth when he burps! The player with the most points after Bobby burps wins.

boardgame.name: Neo-Morphosis: The Syndicate's Sleeper
boardgame.description:
The Syndicate's Sleeper expansion for Neo-Morphosis allows for 5 or 6 players. This expansion adds a new mechanic - Betrayer Mode! The syndicate may have an Agent hidden in the crew with their own secret agenda! Who is the traitor? What is their agenda?

Includes two new Crew, Jasper Jackson and Akira Gozen, new alien species, the Tubers, Widows, and Borers. Plus more morphosis and the mighty Behemoth!

Comes with map tiles, item cards, emergency cards, and 10 brand new Missions that can also be played as a campaign!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Blah Blah Blah
boardgame.description:
Finally, a way to make practicing phonics fun!

Master decoding words using phonics with these three decks of increasing difficulty. Race to get rid of your cards by matching sounds and letters, and play wild cards to trip up your opponents!

Blah Blah Blah is a hilariously fun card game, perfect for kids who are just starting to learn to read. Master decoding words using phonics with these three decks of increasing difficulty. Race to get rid of your cards by matching sounds and letters, and play wild cards to trip up your opponents!

How does Blah Blah Blah work?

Every card features a word consisting of three letters (or groups of letters). Each player takes seven cards. One card is placed face-up on the table with the rest of the deck in a pile, face-down. Players must play a card from their hand that contains at least one of the letters that are in the word on the table. The first player to get rid of all their cards wins. But beware! Wild cards hidden in the deck can force you to skip your turn or draw more cards.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sovereign Skies: Metal Energy Coins
boardgame.description: Metal tokens to replace the cardboard chits that come with the game.

boardgame.name: CYBER/TOPO Subway Train
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Need a lift, hombre?" Just so happens, you got a ticket to ride! This is an encounter map inspired by a dystopian cyberpunk future and features a subway train consisting of 3 passenger cars and 2 control cars. The map:


Comes in both grid and grid-less format. PDF and PNG
Incorporates gaming features such as cover, close quarters combat, and lighting to allow for maximum awesomeness.
The map is 44 x 7.



Add to Roll20 or your favorite digital gaming service to enhance your gaming sessions! Print it out and add minis to utilize the 1" grid!

boardgame.name: CYBER/TOPO Junkyard and Hideout
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"What ya lookin to scrap, choomba?" Whatever it is, this place has all the means of doing so This is an encounter map inspired by a dystopian cyberpunk future and features an junkyard complete with an office, biker hideout, and all the junk you would ever need. The map:


Comes in both grid and grid-less format
Sized 20 x 29 inches, each inch representing 5 feet.
Incorporates gaming features such as cover, close quarters combat, and lighting to allow for maximum awesomeness.


Add to Roll20 or your favorite digital gaming service to enhance your gaming sessions! Print it out and add minis to utilize the 1" grid!

boardgame.name: CYBER/TOPO Shopping Arcade
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"What'cha looking to buy, deck jockey?" Whatever it is, this place has it all! This is an encounter map inspired by a dystopian cyberpunk future and features an outdoor mall, complete with a bar, club, 3 restaurants, antique store, and a back room gambling den. There are also doors on the outer edge of the map so you can include your own locations linked to this one. The map:


Comes in both grid and grid-less format. PDF and PNG
Sized 20 x 28 inches, each inch representing 5 feet.
Incorporates gaming features such as cover, close quarters combat, and lighting to allow for maximum awesomeness.
Includes several neon light sources to create the feel of an epic outdoor shopping mall reminiscent of Tokyo and Osaka.
Features a five-star, digital restaurant for the more well-to-do members of your group



Add to Roll20 or your favorite digital gaming service to enhance your gaming sessions! Print it out and add minis to utilize the 1" grid!

boardgame.name: CYBER/TOPO Hotel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Do you have a reservation, booster?" Just so happens, you are a member of the 4-star club! This is an encounter map inspired by a dystopian cyberpunk future and features a two-story, state-of-the-art hotel, complete with all levels of accommodations and seedy side businesses. The map:


Comes in both grid and grid-less format. PDF and PNG
2 separate maps, sized 14 x 19 inches, each inch representing 5 feet. One for each story.
Includes all levels of accommodations, ranging from a mattress on a floor to a suite on the second story.
Each room is distinct from the other, including “functional” rooms on the second story. These rooms include: an arms dealer, a drug den, a chop shop, “doctor’s” office, meeting room, and illegal netrunner facility.
Incorporates gaming features such as cover, close quarters combat, and lighting to allow for maximum awesomeness.
The wide variety of rooms allows the GM to use it multiple times. Need a chop shop? Use room 203. Need crime scene? Use 205.



Add to Roll20 or your favorite digital gaming service to enhance your gaming sessions! Print it out and add minis to utilize the 1" grid!

boardgame.name: CYBER/TOPO Warehouse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"You got everything on the manifest, high-speed?" Not only will you have all of the products on the list, you get all of the bells and whistles of a full-scale dock operation! This is an encounter map inspired by a dystopian cyberpunk future and features an operational, dockside warehouse. The map:


Comes in both grid and grid-less format. PDF and PNG
Sized 25 x 28 inches, each inch representing 5 feet.
Incorporates gaming features such as cover and lighting to allow for maximum awesomeness.
Includes multiple ways for you netrunner to interface with futuristic technology such as loaders and sorters.
Features a beautifully polluted dockside area, complete with floating sludge and barrels.



Add to Roll20 or your favorite digital gaming service to enhance your gaming sessions! Print it out and add minis to utilize the 1" grid!

boardgame.name: CYBER/TOPO Corporate Penthouse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Do you have an appointment, street rat?" It doesn't matter because now you own the joint! This is an encounter map inspired by a dystopian cyberpunk future and features a luxurious corporate office, complete with a receptionist's desk, meeting room, and weapon storage. The map:


Comes in both grid and grid-less format. PDF and PNG
Sized 19 x 22 inches, each inch representing 5 feet.
Incorporates gaming features such as cover, close quarters combat, difficult terrain, and lighting to allow for maximum awesomeness.
Includes multiple ways for you netrunner to interface with futuristic technology such as robots, drones, and an elevator.
Features a balcony where your NPCs and PCs can look out upon the post-apocalyptic landscape.



Add to Roll20 or your favorite digital gaming service to enhance your gaming sessions! Print it out and add minis to utilize the 1" grid!

boardgame.name: CYBER/TOPO Bar, Arms Dealer, and Chop Shop
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Are you on the list, chump?" If you weren't, now you are! This is an encounter map inspired by a dystopian cyberpunk future and features a themed bar, a chop shop for all your netrunning needs, and an arms dealer who has no qualms about showing their wares. The map:


Comes in both grid and grid-less format. PDF and PNG
Sized 20 x 25 inches, each inch representing 5 feet.
Incorporates gaming features such as cover and lighting to allow for maximum awesomeness.
3 distinct locations as well as street access and alleyway.



Add to Roll20 or your favorite digital gaming service to enhance your gaming sessions! Print it out and add minis and utilize the 1" grid.

boardgame.name: CYBER/TOPO Back Alleyway
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Wanna take it outside, punk?" Well, now you can! This is an encounter map inspired by a dystopian cyberpunk future and features the desirable vacation destination of a back alleyway. The map:


Is sized 26 x 7 inches, each inch representing 5 feet.
Comes in both grid and grid-less format.
Incorporates gaming features such as cover and lighting to allow for maximum awesomeness.



Print it out, or add it to Roll20 or your favorite digital gaming service to enhance your gaming sessions!

boardgame.name: Krasse Kacke: Mammut Promokarten
Who did it?: Mammoth Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
A package of promotional cards of another animal for 'Who did it?' which the community voted for in a facebook voting in March 2019.

Six additional cards showing a mammoth in each of the original player colors. Another animal that you also have to remember when trying to figuring out 'Who did it?'.

listing.notes:
Available with pink or blue in the front (contents are allways the same).
Somebody brought to my attention that the German edition of the game has bigger cards than other languages.
NEW, IN SHRINK ! ! !

boardgame.name: Rituels
boardgame.description:
Inspired by the game For the Queen, Rituels (french for "Rituals"), is a card-based story-building game that you and up to five other players can begin playing in minutes. Choose your cult and ritual, then use the prompt cards to collaboratively tell a story of love, betrayal, doubt, and devotion.

Rituels will have you roam the lands of cultists trying to summon a creature capable of destroying the whole univers. But will all partakers go through with this plan till the end?

The game suggests 8 Cults and 8 Rituals.
The prompt cards are divided in 2 decks: Act I (Why did the characters join the cult, what are their hopes and dreams?) and Act II (What are these nightmares troubling your sleep more and more as the day of the Ritual is getting closer? Are your teammates trustworthy? Are you really one the right side?).
A Final Act in a black envelop will have you secretly vote for the success or failure of the Ritual, ending the game one of three ways.

boardgame.name: Normandy '44: Mounted Map
boardgame.description:
Based on positive feedback to our mounted mapboard releases, we are continuing to offer mounted maps for several of our most popular games as P500 items.

We are now offering one 22 x 34" mounted map for Mark Simonitch's Normandy '44. Enjoy!

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
CLS Games - Atlanta's Board Game Warehouse - is the largest retailer of board games in metro Atlanta! All games are new.
NORMANDY 44 MOUNTED MAP: $48.99 GMT Games [GMT 1008-MM]
SHIPPING Continental U.S. - $15.95 International (Including AK & HI) - TBD

boardgame.name: Donjons & Siphons
boardgame.description:
Inspired by the game For the Queen, Donjons & Siphons (french for "Dungeons and Plumbing Traps"), is a card-based story-building game that you and up to five other players can begin playing in minutes. Choose your dungeon and use the prompt cards to collaboratively tell a story of love, conspiration, doubt, and hardships.

Donjons & Siphons will let you take on the fabulous roles of janitors in a dungeon, competing to become the Chief Janitor.
The game suggests 10 base characters (with different special powers and races). The players then take turns answering prompts from the Event deck. The cards of this deck have two questions: one for you and for your shift teammate (another player).
When the Event deck is empty, you'll have to vote for the best Chief (other than you). The game ends with the Chief's speech.

boardgame.name: Don't drop the soap: Deathrow
Lâche pas la savonnette: Couloir de la mort
boardgame.description:
The Social Card game where there are no winners, just one loser.
Don’t Drop The Soap is a dark humored, fast-paced card game of hot potato set in a prison shower. Players take the role of prison inmates who are, literally, trying to screw each other over. The objective of the game is to not be the player who drops the soap.
Each turn players must play one action card from their hand. The game ends when a player runs out of options and is forced to play a soap card. Although you may never win a game of ‘Don’t Drop The Soap’ you can influence the game in such a way that you decides who loses.

Are you skilled enough to get the booty you want? Or will you end up as someone else prison bitch? You do what you gotta do in here, just Don’t Drop The Soap.

"One last soap before we go?"
Deathrow is first expansion for Don’t drop the soap with additional cards!

Boereplaas Uitbreidingstel 1 expands the original Boereplaas with 72 new cards.

These new cards promises more interaction between players as well as more powerful bonus cards.

The rules for three different game modes are also included: Original, Strategic and Blitz.

boardgame.name: Rainbow Yatzy
boardgame.description: Roll the dice inside the rainbow box and try to match the colours in order to collect cards. The more cards you collect, the higher your score will be. Be careful though, because sometimes your efforts may end up helping out the next player...

boardgame.name: Trusis

Some humans in a house, with other strange monsters called Trusis that every night kill someone.
Take your character and collaborate with your faction (humans, Trusis, aliens or castaway) to remain alive until the end. Talk, accuse others, defend yourself and use your powers to achieve your goal.
