boardgame.name: Chakan Board Game
boardgame.description:
Join Chakan the Forever Man as he traverses the “Journey of 100 Candles” spell with the fate of the world hanging in the balance. Can the greatest warrior of "The Before" time finally rematch Death himself and free himself
from the “Immortality Curse”? Play on!!!!

To play the game: roll a d6 to move your token, follow the directions on the space you land on (e.g., draw a Fate Card, Battle another player, draw an Encounter Card). You earn points by collecting various Encounter Cards, saving Energy points, and triggering the end of the game. The player with the most total points wins!

listing.notes: Opened in order to remove old rubber band residue (marking remains on some cards). Unplayed.

boardgame.name: Tourney
boardgame.description:
Tourney is a tycoon style simulator / simulation PC game. It will allow you to take control of a medieval noble house, and then build a tournament or "tourney" ground where you can watch your champions vie for victory, or dive in and get involved in the combat!

The finished game will feature the following:


Build your tourney ground. Event areas for jousting, melee and archery; and buildings such as apothecaries, blacksmiths, stands, ale wagons, hog roasts and more
Choose your champion. Build their skills. Buy them the best armour and weapons.
Fight your way to the top and win the tournament
13 playable houses with unique heraldry, traits and heroes
Keep the peasants and nobility happy to keep the gold rolling in
Hire staff members such as jesters and troubadours


The tournament set in medieval times, and of this world - but your tourney will be set in mythical places such as Avalon or Atlantis. The game will be full of humour and satire - and you'll be able to find references throughout the finished game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Escape From Biostation
boardgame.description:
Escape From BioStation is a sci-fi adventure game which places you in the role of a Rob Bot, the last robot citizen of a dangerous ancient space station.You'll take on a host of evil robots armed with your deadly super squirrel.


Tackle a variety of puzzles, platforming challenges and explore the BioStation which is stuffed with loot, hulking bosses, traps… and acorns!
Comedy sci-fi adventure story
Bizarre and unique puzzles
Titanic boss fights
Upgrade your squirrel with rapid fire or explosive add-ons
Explore the sinister space station from within - and out
Immersive Dynamic soundtrack by Alexei Zakharov (X Series) that ups the musical excitement whilst you fight.


Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Everafter Falls
boardgame.description:
https://everafterfalls.com
Rediscover your life on Everafter Falls.

Farm, fish, craft, and fight to restore the peace in an all new farming adventure. Features split-screen coop, a pet with useful skills, drones, resource-harvesting pixies, a card eating progression system, dungeons to explore and much more!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Giant Space Spider - A Troika! Background
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a new background for Troika! Numinous Edition. The background is for luggage that was built by a now-vanished civilisation.

This is a single page layered PDF. See the video for printing help.

Image: Jacob E. Blackmon

Compatible with Troika! "Giant Space Spider" is an independent production by Azukail Games and is not affiliated with the Melsonian Arts Council.

boardgame.name: 100 Rumours for Saga of the Goblin Horde
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a collection of 100 rumours for the Saga of the Goblin Horde setting from Zadmar Games. The rumours are system-neutral, so can be used with whatever system is used to play the setting, not just Savage Worlds. These rumours can be used as potential adventure hooks, sources of misinformation or simply as background colour.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

One goblin boss is planning a raid into the human lands with the specific aim of killing the plant-eaters that town humans rely on, especially those that they raise for food or that their warriors ride into battle. The goblin believes that killing the plant-eaters in large numbers will demoralise the town humans, by depriving them of the food that the plant-eaters provide, and their mobility in battle. Some town humans may even be upset over losing a beloved plant-eater.

One gremlin has come up with a new invention that they want to build and test. It's an underwater boat, and the apparent idea behind it is to create a boat that will be able to safely travel the Endless Sea without falling foul of the sea goblins. No goblin wants to be part of this test, as they fail to see just how a boat that is already partially sunk will fare any better against the sea goblins than one floating on the surface.

One of the goblin chiefs is trying to encourage all the goblin tribes to unite, claiming that this is necessary to defeat the human threat. They are also claiming that goblins used to be united, and that doing so again would be favourable to the gods. The tribal chiefs are less them impressed with this idea, especially as the boss in question wants all the tribes to be united under their, supposedly divinely inspired, leadership.

One of the priests of the Shadow Queen is attempting to convince the rest of the priesthood that they need to start summoning smoke sentinels in greater numbers than they have ever been summoned before, in order to raise an army of the elemental creatures to defend against the humans, by launching an attack into the human lands. The behaviour of this priest is generally considered to be on the odd side, and most are worried about just why they truly want to raise an army of elemental servants.

Orcafolk have been getting more aggressive of late, frequently coming onto the shore to attack any goblins they can find, and not just to avoid sea goblins. It's rumoured that they are acting in an even more aggressive manner towards the sea goblins, and that orcafolk and sea goblins are effectively in open warfare in places.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter and one page is ads.

boardgame.name: 100 Sci-Fi Mercenary Companies
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

War never changes, or so the old saying goes. While the weapons of the future may fire beams of concentrated light, and the battlefields may be on the fringe worlds of the galaxy, the iron trade will never die so long as peace remains a hope rather than a reality.

And as long as there are wars being fought, there will be those willing to exchange blood for credits.

From rough-and-tumble outfits like the Snake Eaters, to shadowy organizations like the Nebula Cartel, to companies as high-priced as they are high-tech like the Star Dragons, there's no shortage of soldiers of fortune out there. And whether your game takes place in a far-flung galaxy, in the depths of the void, or in the concrete jungle of a capital city in a cyberpunk dystopia, there's something here to fit your needs.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Void Phantoms: There is nothing in space to slow your momentum, so once you've achieved a certain thrust you can simply throttle off as long as there's nothing in your path. The Void Phantoms, who favor specially-engineered black ships that are nearly impossible to scan from any real distance, use this trick of physics to their advantage. They'll set a course, rocket towards it, then shut down all but the most necessary life support systems in order to go completely black. Transit on these mostly dead vessels can take weeks, but once they do return to life it's like the Void Phantoms materialized out of dead space. Using surprise to their advantage, they quickly cripple their targets, striking decisive blows before their victims can react.

Splicers: Splicers are a terror to behold once they've been deployed to a combat zone. Genetically modified soldiers, every Splicer is keyed to fulfill a particular purpose within the company. From gargantuan vanguard troops that can rip the big gun off a tank with their bare hands, to bird-like riflemen who can hit targets beyond the sight of unmodified soldiers, these troops are apex predators in (mostly) human form. While many who sign up volunteer for these treatments and gene therapies, there are rumors and horror stories about what goes on in the depths of the Splicers' labs... especially when it comes to how they've discovered (and utilized) certain strands of inhuman DNA.

Black Outs: There's nothing easier to defeat than an enemy that's been blinded. The Black Outs specialize in wrecking enemy communications, with operations as subtle as hacking satellites, to as direct as targeted EMP blasts. Losing the ability to coordinate forces for a day, or just for a few crucial hours, can be enough to turn the tide of a war. Rarely working more than a single mission at a time, these saboteurs are nasty pieces of work.

Ratchet Brigade: With their patchwork vehicles and cobbled together weapons, most armies don't take the Ratchet Brigade seriously when they first lay eyes on them... a mistake many don't survive to learn from. These half-mad engineers-for-hire seek out only the hottest battlefields and sign on where it's likely the destruction will be greatest. What confuses most clients is they barely charge any fees for their services... but their contracts do stipulate scrap and salvage rights on enemy weapons, vehicles and other materials. Because while the junk left scattered around the battlefield might be considered worthless to a lot of their employers, it's invaluable to the Brigade as it allows them to keep their armory full, and war chest near to bursting.

Badlanders: Recruited from some of the harshest environments that war has to offer, this mercenary company is old-school in the extreme. From arrow snipers, to gutting knives, to handmade booby traps and ancient stalkers' tricks, they can often outfox the most advanced foes through experience and tactics. Extraordinary scouts, the Badlanders are often underestimated by enemies who confuse their lack of technological equipment with a lack of sophistication or know-how. A mistake that has cost more than a few overconfident generals their lives.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter and half a page is ads.

boardgame.name: d66 Stronghold Flaws
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In the chapter on The Stronghold in the Forbidden Lands Player's Handbook, there is a d6 table of flaws that an old adventure site being converted into a stronghold might have. This table is short, and so this supplement adds more flaws for greater variety.

Here are some sample results:

A strong smell of brimstone permeates the place, seemingly seeping up from beneath ground.

Gryphons nest in the upper reaches (see page 102 in the Gamemaster's Guide).

Secret tunnels riddle the structure, and there are entrances whose locations are not known.

One page is the front cover and one page credits and ads.

boardgame.name: Disci
boardgame.description:
In Disci, you want to move your pieces across the board and into the opponent's starting zone before they can do the same. You can move pieces individually or jump over a piece to land on the empty space just past it. In doing so, however, you may not enter the large space in the center of the board. What's more, if you end up on a space marked with an "X", you must vacate this space in the next round, even moving backwards toward your starting area, if necessary.

The opponent cannot block you by leaving pieces in their starting zone as those spaces count as filled and will make it easier for you to win.

listing.notes: Never played. Smoke free home.

boardgame.name: #NEW (Issue 1)
boardgame.description:
In questo numero:


Anteprima: Tales from the Loop! Il GdR fenomeno che conquista il mondo delle Serie TV.
Coriolis: Viaggi spaziali. Vivete avventure straordinarie a bordo della vostra nave spaziale.
Trudvang Chronicles: Vildheart e altri racconti del mondo di Trudvang.
Shadow of the Demon Lord: Fedi e Divinità di Urth
Cypher System Gods of the Fall: Eroi Divini della prima ambientazione fantasy del Cypher System
13th Age: Mostri della 13° Era.

boardgame.name: Unterherz #2019
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

I run a blog. So far, so common. I fill it mostly with RPG-related articles, often OSR-themed, often written with LotFP or VotE in mind. In 2018, I began to release the LotFP material as a should-beannual zine I called “Gregorius´Notes”.

This here is the attempt to create a sister for it. Unterherz. This issue contains next to all Veins-of-the-Earth relevant material up to 2019. Articles about in food in the Veins, a religion, lots of magic items, even a little “side quest”.

Includes:
Food in the Veins (eight detailed examples)
Post-Battle Cannibalismn (or: how to make the most of a corpse)
The Soup-Wyrm (a provider of nourishment. Yet a dangerous, bizarre monster)
Encounters Near a Veins´City (eight in total, based on the known Pariah of the Earth)
Stupid, Stupid Cambrimen (four new ways they may react in)
Giant Scutigera (a more mundane, over-sized bug-critter)
Little Lightthieves (everything but mundane)
Four Peculiar Light Sources (guess...)
Magic Items in the Veins (a brief article and 24 magic items)
The King That Was and Will Be (a potential religion for the Veins)
Lair of the Child-Robber (side-quest and mini-dungeon)

24 pages in total; 19 pages of content

boardgame.name: #NEW (Issue 2)
boardgame.description:
In questo numero:


Anteprima: Numenera Discovery & destiny! Il gioco campione di incassi di Monte Cook Games che vi terrà compagnia per tutta l’estate!
Coriolis: Scoprite la stazione spaziale di Coriolis!
Trudvang Chronicles: Natura Selvaggia. Sopravvivere nelle terre di Trudvang
Shadow of the Demon Lord: Atlante di Urth
True20: Bestiario. Scopri tutto sui Draghi!
13th Age: Mostri della 13° Era

boardgame.name: #NEW (Issue 3)
boardgame.description:
In questo numero:


Anteprima: Degenesis! Scoprite come il mondo è sopravvissuto alla sua Apocalisse in questo bellissimo GDR
Shadow of the Demon Lord: Come creare avventure horror!
Coriolis: Esplorate il sistema di Kua
Trudvang Chronicles: Il Vitner e la magia di Trudvang
True20: Bestiario. Scopri tutto sui demoni
The Strange: L'anomalia e i Dossier della Fondazione.

boardgame.name: Boarswood
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Welcome to Boarswood!

A small fictional barony that was written as a staging area for your own sessions. Tiny hamlets, proper villages and a small town form the fiefdom that Baron Payton rules overs. The assumed period is “somewhere in the Tudor area / during the 15th or 16th century”. All locations come with a brief description that help to imagine the place but do not weigh themselves down with an abundance of details that would be tiresome to read, hard to reference. The most likely NPC to deal with the party are given names and brief descriptions as well. Taverns and inns are given the same treatment, because the PC are likely to spend much time there in-between adventures. Same is true for the vendors of special goods, as a gun maker or armorer may easily become a given PC´s best friend (everybody loves a returning customer).

A large part of the document are detailed price lists for locations and special vendors, all of them meant to be printed as handouts for the players or as handy cheat-sheets for the GM.

Ten plot hooks/ideas for side quests are given as well, so that Boarswood itself may become the stage for one more adventures of the PC.

boardgame.name: #NEW (Issue 4)
boardgame.description:
In questo numero:


Anteprima: Conan! Scoprite tutto sulla fantastica Era Hyboriana
Degenesis: Culture e Culti dell’Europa post-apocalittica
Shadow of the Demon Lord: Tradizioni arcane di Urth!
Coriolis: Oltre il sistema di Kua
Numenera: Creare i personaggi
Trudvang Chronicles: Creature leggendarie di Trudvang
The Strange: L’Anomalia e le sue ricorsioni

boardgame.name: Gregorius' Notes: On the Weird OSR Fantasy #Year 2019
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Gregorius´Notes: On the Weird OSR Fantasy #Year 2019is a collection of selected articles I wrote for my blog in said year.

Inside you will find a fictional heathen religion with a matching new character class, an adaption of Lovecraft´s Merchants of the Black Galleys, magic items, two monsters, a mysterious NPC that is allied to one of them, a description for another world overlapping with ours, a little side-quest and other articles.

All written for and compatible with Lamentations of the Flame Princess(tm).

17 pages of content (the other are cover, front matter, etc.

boardgame.name: #NEW (Issue 5)
boardgame.description:
In questo numero:


Anteprima: Blue Rose e il fantasy moderno
Degenesis: L’inizio della fine
Shadow of the Demon Lord: Magia occulta
Coriolis: La storia del Terzo Orizzonte
Numenera: Creare i personaggi: Tipi
Trudvang Chronicles: Spiriti non morti
Unmasked: Supereroi e orrore negli anni ’80

boardgame.name: #NEW (Issue 6)
boardgame.description:
In questo numero:


Anteprima: LexOccultum. Misteri e Segreti nell'Europa del XVII secolo
Degenesis: Gli Spitaliani
Shadow of the Demon Lord. Avventura introduttiva. L'ultima Cena
Conan: 2d20 System
Coriolis: Viaggio a Mira
Numenera: Descrittori e focus
Blue Rose: Le Regole Base dell'Age System
boardgame.rpg: Robert E. Howard's Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of

boardgame.name: Beach Slap!
boardgame.description:
Compete to snapshot beach photo assignments for your editor! Up to six people can race to find and arrange hidden objects called out by your impatient editor. This party game contains 48 Snapshot cards and 12 Assignment cards. Fast-paced and silly, this game is full of charming illustrations of a cornucopia of characters!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bettor Horse
boardgame.description:
Can you read your opponent and emerge the better bettor? Are your horses the faster or slower runners versus your opponent's? Successfully bet on horse races to beat your opponent in a game that requires no shuffling and gives you access to your deck the entire game. Find out who the real thoroughbred is in this equestrian, mind-reading competition.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Detetive Cartas
boardgame.description: The Classic Detective won its card version! To solve the mystery of Mr. Carlos Fortuna's murder, players will have to make guesses about the location, weapon and the person responsible for the crime. In each round the participants will be able to eliminate at least one possibility, until finally there will be very few cards left and it will be possible to make an accusation. Whoever succeeds wins the game, but if the guess is wrong the player will be out of the game.

boardgame.name: Cuboingo: 2x2
boardgame.description:
Cuboingo is a puzzle card game in which you match colored patterns to fill up sides of your "Cuboingo!" Jump right into geometric gameplay that can help improve memory, abstract visualization, pattern recognition, and strategy. There are 3 versions of Cuboingo to enjoy (each sold separately). The 2x2 version is the fastest-paced and easiest to learn.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Targeting & Armor Avoidance 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an optional sub-system for Glory Road combat. It is optional because it adds a layer of complexity to an already-complex combat system. When I was ready to publish the full game rules, I realized that the targeting and armor avoidance system we had used over the years was too complex and had largely fallen into disuse, although it was quite popular with some, a sizeable minority, of the players. This is a much simpler system, although it is still not simple.

It does, however, have its advantages. It often makes combat quicker. Using the sub-system may make one round of combat more complex but it can reduce the number of combat rounds. It gives the combatants more meaningful options. If the player-characters use it and their foes do not, it can give the PCs a unique advantage. I admit that I am a meanie and the NPC foes of my characters will use these options but they don’t use them as often as the PCs.

boardgame.name: Cuboingo: 3x3
boardgame.description:
Cuboingo is a puzzle card game in which you match colored patterns to fill up sides of your "Cuboingo!" Jump right into geometric gameplay that can help improve memory, abstract visualization, pattern recognition, and strategy. There are 3 versions of Cuboingo to enjoy (each sold separately). The 3x3 version exercises tactical thinking.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Combate Cartas
boardgame.description: To win, players will have to devise a strategy and choose the correct cards each round in order to eliminate the enemy's army.

boardgame.name: Cuboingo: 4x4
boardgame.description:
Cuboingo is a puzzle card game in which you match colored patterns to fill up sides of your "Cuboingo!" Jump right into geometric gameplay that can help improve memory, abstract visualization, pattern recognition, and strategy. There are 3 versions of Cuboingo to enjoy (each sold separately). The 4x4 version exercises strategic thinking.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: in*die zine (Issue 1 - Sep 2020)
boardgame.description:
Here's what you can find in this issue:

The In*die Network - A manifesto on in*die zine’s mission (Author: Zoe)

Exodus - A game for 3-5 players about standing together when it all falls apart (Author: Andrew Grondin)

The Lonely Giant - A solo journaling game about the last giant living in the lands of humankind (Author: Nick Wedig)

HyperHalfling's Loot Tables - System-agnostic tables of unique and special treasures (Author: The Hyper Halfling)

The Last Rebel - A GM-less, card-based RPG where you play as the galaxy’s last hope (Author: W.H. Arthur)

Première Partie - A collection of characters from *Les Miserables* as a single tabletop move (Author: Logan)

A Wood Heart - Trees have no tongues; but they speak to the heart (Author: James Chip)

Rolling in the Aisles - General advice for running comedic RPG adventures (Author: Dave Joria)

Loot it or Lose it - Special items you might find left behind in any capitalist/consumer hellscape (Author: Sam Gundaker)

Two // One - A lyric game about posing and taking selfies as a thirty ton mecha (Author: Vivian J)

The Maven Guide - Drop-in locations for your RPG, written in a restaurant review format (Author: Alda)

Artefact Affinity - GM-less worldbuilding that uses a tarot deck to inspire scenes from an artifact’s history (Author: Nathan Blades)

Die20! - Why dice are cancelled forever (Author: Julian K)

Gifts of Gods - A one-page RPG about mythology and dying gods (Author: Steve Dee)

Songs and Poems for Yon Adventures - For the bard in you (Author: Sen.H.H.S)

The Summoning - A solo game about a familiar answering a call (Author: Nynphaiel)

Red Box Dawn : The Ballad of Bargle - A retrospective piece on the trauma inflicted on a generation by the Red Box (Author: Andi Lennon)

Subject 3 Prone - A lyric game inspired by the short film This House Has People In It (Author: Georgie Bats)
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Red Box Dawn: The Ballad of Bargle
Songs and Poems for Yon Adventures

boardgame.name: The Lonely Giant
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"There were giants in the earth in those days," say the human priests in their churches. The humans tell themselves that the giants have disappeared from the Earth. And this is true of all giants, save for you.

Before the other giants left, you swore an unbreakable oath. So long as the oath is unfulfilled, you can never die, nor leave your vigil-station. No giant has ever abandoned an oath once sworn.

You swore an oath to watch over something in this land; an oath with no clear end. Even as the world passes you by, you remain on the edge of the human world, watching and acting as your oath requires.

This is a one page journal-writing game for a single player. To play this game, you will need a notebook or another method to record your journaling. You will also need three visually distinct sets of dice, with d4, d6, d8, d10, d12 and d20 in each.

boardgame.name: War of Waves
boardgame.description:
Wield mighty waves and crushing sand to build your gateway to Atlantis before your opponent! Heavy strategy is required to outwit your opponent - choose to attack, fortify, or build - or combine different actions, and every choice determines what cards you draw; populate each bridge section with a war card to allow attacking your opponent's gate or to build your own; build abiding by the rules or fix any mistakes before you claim victory!

Build your bridge and your army while thwarting your opponent's. Learn some Greek to go along with some mythology as you march your army victorious through the gate to the fabled undersea kingdom!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mars Horizon
boardgame.description:
Lead a major space agency as you guide humanity to Mars in this strategy simulation game. Construct a base, design and build rockets, conduct missions throughout the Solar System, and write your own history of Space exploration. Created with support from the European Space Agency.

Source: [ https://theirregularcorporation.com/game/mars-horizon/].

boardgame.name: Kygor Noir: Ghost in the Machine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A 7-10 session adventure for players starting at 8th level.

The CEO of Morenkain Industries has been murdered in cold blood.

The culprits are many. Evidence, both false and real, abounds. Paranormal activity haunts the crime scene.

The party has been hired to investigate, but with corporate politics, mafia families, union negotiations, and the mysterious world of virtual reality immersion at play, can they get to the bottom of things before it's too late?

boardgame.name: Curse of the Sea Rats
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.




What would you do to be free?
Curse of the Sea Rats is an epic hand-drawn ratoidvania starring a group of heroes transformed into rats by a pirate witch.

Help Douglas, Buffalo, Akane, and Bussa to rescue the Admiral’s son, capture the evil pirate Flora Burn and break the magic spell.

Curse of the Sea Rats packs all of the best features from the Metroidvania genre featuring beautiful 2D hand-drawn animation and 3D environments, combined with unique real-time combat mechanics, and of course, lots of rats!.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Gunner of Dragoon
boardgame.description:
This is VR dragon riding shooter!
Why can we not ride a dragon? Because a dragon is not in this world!
So let's make a dive in the world where a dragon is alive!

boardgame.name: The Last Faith
boardgame.description: The Last Faith is an exploration-based Metroidvania, action side-scrolling platformer with dark and gothic themes at its core.

boardgame.name: Aeon's End Outcasts: Promos
boardgame.description:
Promo pack for Aeons's End. Contains promo cards P096 through P123, SD-058, and NA-END-044.

This pack includes:

Coruscating Sapal and randomizer - Gem
Force Catalyst and randomizer - Spell
Humming Shell and randomizer - Relic
2 Treasured Gems
2 Treasures Level 2
3 Treasures Level 3
2 Upgraded Basic Nemesis Attacks
2 Upgraded Basic Nemesis Powers
3 Xaxos: Outcast Abilities
2 additional story related randomizers

boardgame.name: Golygame
boardgame.description:
Golygame is a football theme board game played with chips (players and ball) and dice for passing, shooting, tackling, etc. It combines the strategy thinking to make right actions in your turn with the luck that the dice bring to the game. Score three goals before your rival to be the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Diecast Derby
boardgame.description:
Using only Diecast Toy Cars and 9 Print and Play cards, Drivers attempt to position their cars first place by the end of the race. Play occurs over an extremely limited number of card plays (less than 4 per lap/race) so each individual card play requires strategy and tactics.

Solo puzzle mode and three variant play modes are included in the original rules.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Clash at Rook's Point
boardgame.description:
Rook’s Point: Center of power, magic…and mystery. Factions will rise and forces will convene, vying for control of this mystical apex. Control Rook’s Point, control the world.

Choose your faction and fight your opponent. Use your powers, abilities, and sheer strength to answer the ultimate question: who will be the last one standing when warriors Clash at Rook’s Point?
Players will choose a faction of three characters, all with their own unique powers and abilities. Decks are identical, each containing the same cards, the only difference is how they are shuffled. Heal your characters, take two actions, and move to the next player. Gameplay is fast and furious, with no forgiveness for mistakes. Knock out all of an opponent’s characters to eliminate them from the game. Be the last player standing to win control of Rook’s Point—but beware! Strategies and alliances might work this time, but how long will they last?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Fleet: The Dice Game – Captain & Trophy Expansion
boardgame.description:
Fleet: The Dice Game - Captain & Trophy Expansion includes:

5 - Starting Captains - Players can draft these cards at the beginning of the game to grant special starting positions

10 - Trophy Cards - 5 of these will provide mid-game bonuses for the first player to reach their condition. The other 5 will provide end game bonuses - using 1 of the 5 per game.

You do not need these cards if you own the Fleet: The Dice Game – Deluxe Extras.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Fleet: The Dice Game – Deluxe Extras

boardgame.name: King's Forge: Color-Blind Friendly "Wood" Dice
boardgame.description: Replacement dice for the wood dice that came with King's Forge that have a more easily distinguishable color.

boardgame.name: Fleet: The Dice Game – Score Pads
boardgame.description: Each scorepad contains 50 double-sided sheets for 100 additional plays.

boardgame.name: D.U.M.P. Quest - Witch's Treasure
boardgame.description:
Dump Quest is a simple, word ad-libbing, roleplaying, destructible game built using the Ad-Lib Engine.

The game contains blank "ad-lib" forms to create encounters, player character abilities, and backstories. Words are provided by players without knowing the context in which they will be used, resulting in unpredictable scenarios.
Pages can contain tear-outs representing "ad-libbed" item rewards for players.

Dump Quest: Witch's Treasure is the first issue of Dump Quest. It follows a party of adventurers tasked by a witch to clear out an invasive cult from her subterranean home. If successful, they've been promised a reward of a spectacular treasure.

Originally distributed on Kickstarter

boardgame.name: Maratón Ligero
boardgame.description:
Maratón Ligero ("Light Marathon"), is one of versions of Maratón, a Mexican trivia game created by Sergio Schaar Chabat. In this case, the questions, according to the text in the back of the box, are specialized in pop music, movie hits, sports and TV shows, contrary to the original one, who was more into general culture.

To play, a player rolls the dice and a judge reads a numered question in the front of the card, according to the dice points. After the player ansewers, the judge checks the back of the card to confirm. If the player was right, his token advances, if not, another player can doit. Is nobody knows it, then a black token called Ignorancia (Ignorance), advances.

The winner is the first player to reach the end line. If the Ignorance token does first, everybody loses.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Grupo Editorial Maratón S.A. de C.V.

boardgame.name: /OSRG/ Zine (Volume 1)
boardgame.description:
The Scorched Coast

This Zine is unofficial and fan created by the /OSRG/ community.

This is not a commercial product, nor meant for commercial distribution.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: /OSRG/ Zine (Volume 2)
boardgame.description:
/OSRG/ Zine
Volume II
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Circino: le Chasseur de Trésors – Destination Bouches-du-Rhône
boardgame.description:
Circino A Treasure Hunt in the Bouches-du-Rhône

From Marseille to Aubagne, via Aix-en-Provence, La Ciotat, Arles etc ... 36 municipalities of the "13" department will occupy a central and predominant spot in the game.

Goal of the game
The players select 8 "Objective" cards (= 8 communes) and they collect the 8 "Objective" pellets corresponding to these 8 cards. They shuffle them face down then place them on the different chests on the game board.

Each player then collects at random or he chooses 2 "Objective" cards among the 8 selected.

The goal of the game will consist in finding the 2 “Objective” pellets corresponding to his 2 cards then in bringing them back the 1st to Circino in the center of the board ... with as only weapons the dice and his sense of adventure!

In their quest, players will not be alone and can count on the help of members of the Circino family through Bonus Cards.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Castle Courtyard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Castle Courtyard is 27 x 27 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Map Inn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Inn is a map of an inn. Map is 17x11 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Map Fort
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Fort is a map of a fort. Map is 50x50 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Map Shop
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Shop is a map of a shop. Map is 13x7 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Keep is a map of a keep. Map is 34x34 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Fall Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Fall Village is a map of a village in the fall. Map is 40x40 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Battlemap Snow Inn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Battlemap Snow Inn is a map of an inn at a crossroads in the snow. Map is 40x30 in 70 pixels per inch.

boardgame.name: Witch's Shrine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A gigantic skull sits central on a platform of ancient stone and moss, four paths span the chasms that surround this skull, one path however has broken over the ages and now a gap lies between. The dark and dreary forest blocks the light from above and produces a sickly smell of death.

Within the ancient skull lies three small altars, each with the skull of an animal of the woods. Around them candles flicker gently providing ambient light and in front of the altars lies a small hole used for sacrifices.

boardgame.name: Bon Appetit
boardgame.description:
Bon Appetit is a simple word game. Each alphabet has turned into a delicious cuisine, by using them to form a word, you will have a grant feast.
Bon Appetit!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 動文字
boardgame.description:
動文字 is a Chinese word game, or should I say, “character game”.
Using radicals and components to puzzle a Chinese character and spell it. Learning Chinese in a exciting competition!
Can you master this ancient and elegant language? 動文字 will show you a whole new world of Chinese learning!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: What Do You Meme?: TikTok Edition
boardgame.description:
What Do You Meme? but with the Photo Cards being from TikTok memes.

Each round, the judge chooses a Photo Card. Each of the other players chooses a Caption Card. The judge chooses which caption is funniest, and the player who chose that card gets a point.
Keep playing until you don't want anymore.

listing.notes: New in shrink.

boardgame.name: Die Schatzinsel der Piratenopas
boardgame.description:
Die Schatzinsel der Piratenopas (The Treasure Island of Pirate Grandpas) is a handmade wooden children's game from 5 years up. It is made in the “Urdonautal” in the heart of Bavaria.
It is also ideally suited as a family game, because it is just as fun for adults and offers new challenges for experienced players because there are rule extensions that can optionally be included in the game. In addition to a little luck, a good memory is required, because if you can remember which types of treasure are hidden in which place, you have a good chance of winning the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Proyecto S
boardgame.description: Construct your deck in an initial phase of secret bidding combined with drafting. Use your new cards and their special powers in a second round of secret biding to win victory points, but make sure not to use all your tricks before the final round because if you lose it your victory points will not count.

boardgame.name: 九龍城寨
九龙城寨 (The City of Darkness)
boardgame.description:
City of Darkness(Chinese name:九龙城寨/九龍城寨,means Kowloon walled city) is a board game adapted from the comic of the same name.
Players play the roles in the comics and use their unique decks to fight for territory in Kowloon Walled City.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Malign Portents
boardgame.description:
It began with unsettling dreams, and unnatural lights in the sky. Tempers frayed, families fractured and rulers became irate as their subjects fell to distraction and gossip. There was something in the air, they said; some malediction that threatened to turn the disquiet into dread. Waking nightmares spread across every land, promising a deathly face or the terror of oblivion. Traders and explorers carried ominous accounts through Realmgates only to find those on the other side bore disturbing stories of their own. This period became known as the Time of Tribulation, and it was well-named.

Malign Portents is an 80-page hardback book containing background and rules which catapult the mortal realms into a time of grim uncertainty, as Nagash begins an aeons-long grand plan to assert his power over the dead, spreading the necrotic influence of Shyish over every realm. Of course, the visions of disaster this plan is causing have not gone unnoticed – Khorne, Nurgle, Tzeentch, Slaanesh, the Horned Rat and Sigmar himself are affected by these portents, and every faction in the mortal realms is moving against the undead hordes of Nagash.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition) Core Rules

boardgame.name: SiegKrone
boardgame.description:
SiegKrone (means Victory Crown) is a trading card game published by famous Japanese SNS company GREE. The game contains a lot of mobile game ip and anime ip like attack on titan.

Like most tcgs, in this game, players should construct their own deck with 50 cards to fight with the opponent. Players play character cards to fight and use skill cards to help. Some character cards can evolution or awake. The player who causes 5 points of damage to the opposing player will win the game.

boardgame.name: Changemakers Adventure
boardgame.description:
The goal of Adventure is to help to grow a changemaker that is in yourself and to develop world changing teams. Throughout the game you develop your performing courage, listening skill and lot more.

To be the first one to reach the top of the mountain you have to do a variety of tasks. For example you can share about your childhood, make a speech, compete with fellow players, give promises or guess other people's personality types.

After each activity/question you will get point based on your performance.
Who's the first on top of the mountain, has changed the world for the better, like a changemaker.

boardgame.name: Kosmiczny Wykop
boardgame.description:
Galactic football from the Cosmic Kick series has moved to the game board. Together with Robert Lewandowski and the series characters, play the emotional football games full of tactical decisions. The dynamic 2-player gameplay will make you feel like you’re at Spaceball court - the Space Football Federation stadium.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Lost Halls of Scarnascis (DCC)
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:
The Lost Halls of Scarnascis is a Dungeon Crawl Classics adventure for 4-6 characters of 2nd level.

The Lost Halls of Scarnascis
The party has found a magical treasure map. For the map to reveal its secrets, in magical text, it states that they must swear a pact of companionship over personal interest, of generosity over greed, and harmony over discord.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Farbiossis Vernissage
boardgame.description:
“Farbiossis Vernissage” is a handmade wooden family game from 10 years up made in the “Urdonautal” in the heart of Bavaria. Who can best achieve the most points by cleverly collecting and swapping combinations of images?

The goal of the game is to get the most pictures into the own gallery.

At start every player gets 8 pictures on his sorting station.

In each round every player has to put at least 1 (max. 3) of this pictures on his paletts.
The pictures have 3 different characteristics: background, colour and motive. Collect pictures on a palett, that have at least 2 characteristics, that fit.

Then each player fills up his sorting station with new pictures from the reserve.

Every player looks, what picture he didn't need to collect a combination and puts that picture into the middle of the table.

Then everyone chooses pictures from the middle of the table for his sorting station.

If you have no picture that fits to the pictures on the paletts you must bring the pictures of one palette into the gallery and get points.

When the reserve is empty the game ends.

The player who reaches the most points is the winner of the game.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Landsknecht: Renaissance Wargame Rules
boardgame.description:
Landsknecht is a set of rules for the Renaissance period, allowing players to recreate the battles of the Renaissance wars in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Colonels of the period. Between the heavy armour of the gendarmes and the structure of the early pike and shot formation, players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with cunning and bloody stubbornness.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

Landsknecht aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the century, where looks and righteousness were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments and an option to wear over the top fashion was nether missed. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage

boardgame.name: 18Mag: Hungarian Railway History
18Magyarország
boardgame.description:
18Mag (Magyarország meaning Hungary) is an 18xx game that tells the story of Hungarian railroads and their supporting companies.

Depending on the player number, 13 different railway companies are drafted equally between the players. These railways operate in numerical order, build track on the map, erect stations, run their trains and always pay out their earnings 50:50 – half to their owners and half into their own treasury.

Beside those operating railroads, seven other companies offering various services for the railroads are included in the game. Examples of these services are building an extra tile, allowance to run freely over small stations, reduce costs when building bridges and tunnels, and most importantly, offer new trains. Whenever a railroad uses the services of one or more of these companies, they pay their fee into their treasury. In stock rounds, players acquire shares of those companies and after operation rounds, they distribute their earnings among the share holders. These companies also have station markers (or in this case: factories) which can be placed on city tiles (instead of railway stations) by the president of the company, thus denying other companies passage through that city.

Contrary to other 18xx games, all trains are available from the beginning. Because of the pricing, they usually come in the accustomed order, but not necessarily! However, trains do not rust or go obsolete, but they may be scrapped voluntarily to make space for bigger trains. When at least one of each type of train has been sold, one more set of operation rounds is played and then the game ends. As usual in 18xx games, the wealthiest player is the winner.

boardgame.name: Panzer Dragoon VR
Panzer Dragoon: Voyage Record
boardgame.description: It’s not a new chapter in the franchise, however; it will let players relive episodes that appeared in the original Panzer Dragoon, Panzer Dragoon 2 Zwei, and Panzer Dragoon Saga. Players will wield a VR controller that acts as a handgun for the rider.

boardgame.name: Pursuit of the Mystic Seer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The frozen lands have uncovered a merchant party that informs you of trouble in the south at a nearby thorp. The men heard the story 3rd party but understand that a mage is kidnapping people from Zygo Thorp for nefarious purposes. Dealing with a mage will certainly warm your bones and you head south!

Although set in the Pangia Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

boardgame.name: Race for Shataakh-Ulm (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Into the Endless Wastes!

The legendary treasure of the lost Conroi Expedition draws your heroes onwards, but they are not alone in seeking fame and fortune. Factions race across the seemingly endless plains of the Haunted Steppe and must brave its harsh elements, hostile cannibal tribes, and eerie burning undead that crackle with the energies of a forgotten cataclysm. The heroes must piece together the hidden trail left behind a century ago to discover the true prize sought by those ill-fated explorers and must face the rising of an ancient evil from the Lost Lands’ past that could arise to threaten every civilized realm. If they want to enjoy their fabled treasure, the heroes first need to survive!

Race for Shataakh-Ulm is a DnD 5th Edition adventure for 12th-level characters set in the fabled Haunted Steppe in the Lost Lands Campaign Setting. This rich and exciting world 20 years in the making has been home to dozens of adventures from Necromancer Games and Frog God Games and produced with their cooperation to be compatible with The World of the Lost Lands campaign guide! It is the fifth of six adventures in the Aegis of Empires Adventure Path, with each adventure exploring hitherto unexplored areas of the Lost Lands with a combination of horror, intrigue, deadly danger, and the lure of ancient mysteries.

boardgame.name: Grave
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Grave is a toolkit for soulslike adventures adapted from Ben Milton's Knave, compatible with a range of old-school fantasy adventure games. Adaptations to Knave include....

Ready-made "backgrounds" with starting stat arrays and gear packages, including Knight, Wizard, Witch, Outcast, and the wholly random Vagabond
Simple stamina rules based on inventory allotment, for more involved stunts and more frequent spell use
Death, resurrection, and corruption rules based on the assumption that you will die quite a bit, and you might want to risk devouring the souls of legendary kings
60 level-less spells in Wizardry, Witchcraft, and Theurgy
50 magic items like the Ring of the Wily Serpent, Jade Pig, Waxen Hand, and Pendant
